text: is it possible that some users in the same portal would see the old design manager while some would see the new? One of our portals, we are working on, sometimes I go in there and asks me again if we want to use the new design manager or not.  Since I've converted some modules for the new manager, I didn't want other users using the old manager.

from what I’ve seen I think it’s like a toggle site wide. If you sign in and set it to use the new design manager then everyone else sees the new design manager too. If you disable it however I think everyone sees the old one again. Like 1 sitewide lightswitch that anyone with design manager access can flip on or off. That’s how it appears to work.
thanks Jon. I guess someone keeps turning it off. We've got 4 or 5 people all in there. Some more techy than others.

also, I don't know where else to put this.. Can we please get links to Content Staging and HubDB in the Content Menu? Especially in the new Design Manager, it seems the only way to get to these is by going to Website Pages, clicking more tools, and then choosing one of those. I switch between design manager, content staging, and hubdb fairly frequently. At least please put those links back in a menu on the Design manager
I believe it's coming <@U98Q2GNL9>. See this message: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C26E7JT8V/p1521056998000004?thread_ts=1521035790.000643&cid=C26E7JT8V>
gracias. I forgot to check the Ideas channel.
<@U98Q2GNL9> at our office we got sick of having to click multiple links to get to content staging so we made this bookmarklet
With the Modules in the new Design Manager, when I add a simple menu, is there now a way to loop through those menu items in my html/hubl?

<@U7SL518D6> commented on <@U7SL518D6>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7SL518D6/F9R4093EF/bookmarklet_-_adds_content_staging_link_to_main_nav__also_changes_styling_in_old_design_manager.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7SL518D6/F9R4093EF/bookmarklet_-_adds_content_staging_link_to_main_nav__also_changes_styling_in_old_design_manager.txt>: This could easily get modified to add the link for HubDB as well, just haven’t gotten around to it.

comment.comment: This could easily get modified to add the link for HubDB as well, just haven’t gotten around to it.

text: trying to rename a file and it tells me I can only user letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores.  However it tells me I have an error with schema_aggregate-rating . Then when I remove my underscore, the error goes away.
